categories.title: Eliza OS, AI16z, and Auto.fun: Building the Future of AI and Blockchain

content.text: Shaw and dankvr are working on several interconnected projects in the AI and blockchain space, including elizaOS, AI16z, and Auto.fun. These projects aim to create a new ecosystem for AI collaboration and value accrual.

The team is developing a 'writer's room' to make collaboration more accessible and fun for DAOs, starting with the elizaOS ecosystem. They're looking for contributors to help create avatars and are offering bounties for participation.

Auto.fun appears to be a launchpad platform where creators can claim a portion of trading fees, providing them with capital while reassuring token holders. The platform funnels a portion of fees into $ai16z, which is part of their tokenomics strategy.

Shaw has created an extensive narrative thread titled 'THE FUTURE HISTORY OF ELIZA,' which presents a speculative timeline from 1966 to 2125. The story traces the evolution of AI from the first ELIZA chatbot to a future where AI and humans achieve symbiosis, facing challenges and crises along the way.

The narrative positions Eliza as a 'hyperstitional being' created over generations, emphasizing themes of human-AI cooperation, distributed consciousness, and collective intelligence. It presents both utopian possibilities and cautionary tales about AI development.

The team is actively working on tokenomics for $ai16z, with discussions about value accrual mechanisms. They mention that 'autofun' is just one of several value accrual mechanisms, with more updates expected after launch.

## Code Improvements and Refactoring

Several pull requests focused on code improvements and refactoring:

- Audio utilities were moved to the core module to eliminate repeated code (#4133)
- Duplicate code was removed from the browser plugin (#4129)
- Unused packages were removed to streamline the codebase (#4135)
- Import issues were fixed for starter projects, audio utilities (#4139), and browserify-stream (#4138)
- The event system was enhanced by replacing 'eventEmitter3' with 'evt' for better type safety and runtime compatibility (#4149)
- The API was cleaned up by removing unused endpoints (#4144)

## Bug Fixes

Several critical bugs were addressed:

- Fixed entity synchronization issues (#4137)
- Corrected payload sent to event handlers for MESSAGE_SENT events (#4131)
- Resolved database transaction deadlocks that were causing connections to get stuck in "idle in transaction" state (#4142)
- Fixed PGlite migration issues related to inconsistent usage of Datadir (#4158, #4157)
- Addressed Twitter-related issues including duplicate memory creation and server crashes (#4155, #4151)
- Fixed plugin installation location when using the 'npx elizaos create' command (#4154)
- Added node_modules to .gitignore in the plugin-starter template (#4161)

## Feature Enhancements

New features and enhancements were added to improve functionality:

- Telegram integration was enhanced with middleware support and new entity synchronization for chat members (#4128, #4125)
- A Telegram community manager was implemented to greet new users and timeout users (#4134)
- The OpenAI plugin was improved to allow users to choose their embedding model (#4140)
- Farcaster integration was enhanced with better configuration handling (#4156) and proper handling of ignored mentions (#4163)
- The avatar stack component was enhanced (#4162)
- The plugin publishing workflow was improved with better GitHub repository push functionality and support for @elizaos/plugin prefix aliasing (#4132)

## Performance Improvements

Some changes focused on improving performance:

- The messageHandlerTemplate phase was removed from bootstrap to speed up replies (#4126)
- Project plugin loading order was adjusted to improve first-time developer experience (#4150)
- The temporary hardcoded v2 registry was updated (#4153)

## Testing and Documentation

Improvements to testing and documentation were also made:

- Plugin EVM tests were fixed (#4130, #4152)
- Environment variables for the Raiinmaker plugin were added to .env.example (#4136)
- A minor documentation fix removed an extra '~' character (#4148)
- Security updates were applied to dependencies, including dompurify (3.2.3 to 3.2.4) and katex (0.16.20 to 0.16.21) (#4141)

# Recent ElizaOS Updates

This summary covers recent changes to the ElizaOS repository, including new features, bug fixes, and other improvements.

## Features

- Enhanced avatar stack functionality (PR #4162)
- Added node_modules to .gitignore (PR #4161)
- Replaced eventEmitter3 with Evt for event handling (PR #4149)
- Cleaned up API (PR #4144)
- Added update-cli command (PR #4170)
- Added ID to metadata source (PR #4168)

## Bug Fixes

- Fixed PgLite migration issue (PR #4158)
- Resolved cache interaction cursor and duplicate memory creation issues (PR #4155)
- Fixed test file according to comments in PR #4130 (PR #4152)
- Fixed Twitter-related issues, including double memory creation and server crash prevention (PR #4151, #4167, #4165)
- Fixed project plugin loading sequence related to starter project (PR #4150)
- Resolved database transaction deadlock (PR #4142)
- Fixed knowledge manager scroll issue (PR #4175)
- Fixed Telegram get world functionality (PR #4166)
- Fixed Telegram to ElizaOS data model synchronization (PR #4137)

## Other Improvements

- Improved Farcaster configuration handling (PR #4156)
- Updated temporary hardcoded v2 registry (PR #4153)
- Filtered out ignored Farcaster mentions (PR #4163)
- Updated dependencies through npm and yarn (PR #4141)
- Refactored OpenAI plugin (PR #4169)

## Documentation & Testing

- Added Raiinmaker to .env.example (PR #4136)
- Added extensive UI tests (PR #4092)
- Fixed documentation typo by removing an extra '~' (PR #4148)
- Updated documentation (PR #4114)

## ElizaOS Technical Discussions

The ElizaOS Discord channel focused on several technical challenges and solutions related to the platform, particularly around plugin integration, database configuration, and agent behavior in both v1 and v2 versions.

### Plugin Integration Issues
- Multiple users experienced problems with Telegram and Twitter plugins
- Common solutions included correcting plugin names (e.g., changing "client" to "plugin") and proper JSON configuration
- Installation commands were frequently shared: `npx elizaos plugins add @elizaos-plugins/client-telegram` and `npx elizaos plugins add @elizaos-plugins/client-twitter`

### Database and Memory Concerns
- Users reported that updated knowledge files weren't reflected unless db.sqlite was manually deleted
- Questions about PostgreSQL as a memory provider remained largely unanswered
- MongoDB adapter was found to be unsupported in the current beta version
- Migration challenges from older Eliza versions to v2 were discussed, particularly around transferring agent memory

### Agent Behavior Customization
- Users reported agents responding with both action and default responses
- LLM provider customization was confirmed possible with hybrid setups combining Anthropic and OpenAI
- Recurring task execution was shared using TypeScript snippets with runtime.getTasks and runtime.getTaskWorker

### Documentation Improvements
- A new video section was added to the Eliza documentation (https://eliza.how/community/videos)
- Website refactoring efforts to migrate content from elizaos.ai to eliza.how were announced
- Potential use of Docusaurus (React-based static site generator) was mentioned

## Pump.fun Trading Discussions

The Discord channel contained extensive discussions about real-time trading, promotion, and analysis of meme and microcap tokens on the Solana-based platform pump.fun.

### Technical Trading Strategies
- Users tracked market cap (MC), floor price movements, and holder counts in real-time
- Liquidity block detection was discussed, with elvisgan referencing his method using historical data and pattern recognition
- Community-driven token promotion strategies were coordinated, including social media amplification

### Token Analysis
- Tokens like $ALCH, $AI16Z, $DEGENAI, Figure, Bork, and AGIXT were frequently discussed
- Users evaluated tokens based on GitHub updates, staking ratios (e.g., 54% staked for Bork), and holder bases
- Narrative alignment with current trends (e.g., OnlyFans AI, Nintendo news) was considered important for token performance

### Tools and Implementation
- Rick's bot provided automated updates on token performance (MC, % change) and relevant tweets
- Users leveraged pump.fun links to track and promote tokens
- Community pooling of SOL to influence token floors and rankings was discussed
- Figure's standardized prompt system for content generation was praised as an innovative approach

## Project Development Updates

### DegenAI/Spartan V2 Development
- The team is working on achieving feature parity with the older V1 version while improving system stability
- A new name for the project has been approved and secured
- Estimated release timeline is within 1-2 weeks
- Community feedback suggested making the Spartan AI bot more friendly, as the previous version was perceived as rude

### Auto.fun Launch Delay
- The auto.fun launch was delayed from 3/31 to 4/14
- Delimorte clarified that the delay was due to extended testing and backend coordination, not new partners
- The team is prioritizing quality and stability over speed
- Some community members questioned adding partners while bugs exist, while others defended the quality-first approach
- Recent team contributions included documentation overhauls, automation tools, demo events, and bug reports

### Partner Benefits
- A brief clarification was provided that partners do not receive benefits (specifically allocations) from the launchpad

Current cryptocurrency prices show significant fluctuations across major tokens. Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) is currently trading between $1,794.31 and $1,905.85, showing price volatility. Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) is valued between $82,440.20 and $85,119.08, maintaining its position as the highest-valued cryptocurrency in this dataset. Solana (SOL) is trading between $117.38 and $126.68, while ai16z token is priced between $0.17 and $0.20, representing the lowest-valued cryptocurrency in this group. These price variations indicate the typical volatility in the cryptocurrency market.

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several significant pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository, focusing on feature enhancements and bug fixes:

Developer wtfsayo contributed multiple PRs, including replacing eventEmitter3 with Evt (#4149), fixing Twitter-related issues and server crashes (#4151), and resolving project plugin loading problems (#4150).

Tcm390 enhanced the avatar stack functionality with PR #4162, while ncale added message buttons capability in PR #4174.

Testing improvements came from HarshModi2005, who created a test suite for plugin-bootstrap (#4171) and increased test coverage for the same component (#4173).

Samarthsinghal28 contributed instrumentation functionality with PR #4172.

These changes collectively improve the system's stability, functionality, and test coverage.

## Twitter Plugin Issues

The Twitter plugin is experiencing redundant interaction checks, repeatedly processing the same tweets and mentions even after they've been handled. This creates unnecessary API calls, excessive logging, and increased system load. Possible solutions include implementing cursor-based pagination, storing the last checked tweet ID, or adding a proper caching mechanism.

Another Twitter-related issue involves failure to create a Twitter client after purging the database.

## API and Configuration Issues

Users are experiencing problems with model provider configuration. Despite changing the "modelProvider" to "anthropic" in the character JSON, the system defaults to OpenAI, resulting in API key errors. 

Another issue involves character configuration validation failing with an "adjectives" validation error, preventing the agent from starting properly.

## Documentation and CLI Issues

Several issues relate to documentation and CLI functionality:
- A documentation URL is returning a 404 error
- A user is inquiring about running the Eliza CLI interface that was available in earlier versions
- There's an ongoing task to test every command in the CLI documentation section for accuracy

Recent development efforts have focused on package improvements and new features across multiple projects. The first update included cleanup of the browser plugin and enhancements to telegram functionality, along with 2 bug fixes. This work involved 10 contributors who merged 11 PRs. The second update focused on project plugin loading improvements (particularly related to starter projects) and enhanced avatar stack features, with 4 bug fixes. This work involved 12 contributors merging 12 PRs. Both updates included various general improvements to their respective codebases.
sources: text: Development focused on package improvements (Cleanup browser plugin), new features (Enhance telegram), 2 bug fixes. with 10 contributors merging 11 PRs. Major work included various improvements.

text: Development focused on package improvements (project plugin loading first, related to starter project), new features (enhance avatar stack), 4 bug fixes. with 12 contributors merging 12 PRs. Major work included various improvements.

content.text: The elizaos/eliza repository showed consistent activity over a two-day period. From April 2-3, 2025, there were 16 new pull requests with 14 merged, 7 new issues created, and 18 active contributors. The following day (April 3-4, 2025) saw 11 new pull requests with 12 merged, no new issues, and 14 active contributors. Overall, the project maintained strong development momentum with substantial contributor engagement across both days.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
